page.title: 07Shops
page.content: There are 9 shops in Newtyle;the{post {office, a licenced grocer, a co-op {store, a butcher, a general shop,a {fish and chip shop ,a garden centre,a {good-as-new shop,and the school tuck {shop.}The good-as-new shop is a bit like an Oxfam shop except all the money goes towards Newtyle Parish Church. Mrs.E.Buchan a church elder is in charge of it.There are also{mobile {shops.Mr.Richie}from Inverbervie comes in a van to sell fresh fish every Thursday.Mr.J.Guthrie who owns the licenced grocer has a van to serve people living out of the village.On Sunday an{ice-cream van}comes round. The garden centre has a{tea room and an{art gallery,}which sometimes holds exhibitions of the work of local artists such as McIntosh-Patrick,Neil Catchpole and Miss.Broun my art teacher in school.(S.Dallas P7)
